rows.name: button_2
rows.comments: Creates a new field called field_2 with value Value of Field 2

rows.name: text_2
rows.comments: this text would be The value of field_2 is 'undefined' so presumably an empty string or even @field.field_2? until the button is pressed in which case it would change to The value of field_2 is Value of Field 2

rows.name: text_hidden_4
rows.value: This should be hidden when field_4 is TRUE
rows.comments: There could be more complex conditions for shown ie @filed.field_4>3)

rows.name: text_not_hidden_4
rows.value: This should be hidden when field_4 is FALSE

rows.name: text_hidden_5
rows.value: This should be hidden when field_5 is more than 2

rows.name: text_not_hidden_5_a
rows.value: This should be hidden when field_5 is less than or equal to 2

rows.name: text_not_hidden_5_b
rows.value: This should be hidden when field_5 is less than or equal to 2

rows.name: button_set_raw
rows.comments: To set a field to a raw, non-parsed value wrap with backticks `...`

rows.name: text_raw_combined
rows.value:
will not work when combined:
raw: `@fields.example_raw`
parsed: @fields.example_raw
rows.comments: Due to additional check for dynamic field after first parse (e.g. @local.@global.some_field), it's not possible to mix both raw and dynamic values in the same expression. Instead the full expression will be treated as raw
